00041 typedef unsigned long long rthal_time_t;
00042 
00043 #define __rthal_u64tou32(ull, h, l) ({          \
00044     unsigned long long _ull = (ull);            \
00045     (l) = _ull & 0xffffffff;                    \
00046     (h) = _ull >> 32;                           \
00047 })
00048 
00049 #define __rthal_u64fromu32(h, l) ({             \
00050     unsigned long long _ull;                    \
00051     asm ( "": "=A"(_ull) : "d"(h), "a"(l));     \
00052     _ull;                                       \
00053 })
00054 
00055 /* Fast longs multiplication. */
00056 static inline __attribute_const__ unsigned long long
00057 rthal_ullmul(unsigned long m1, unsigned long m2) {
00058     /* Gcc (at least for versions 2.95 and higher) optimises correctly here. */
00059     return (unsigned long long) m1 * m2;
00060 }
00061 
00062 /* const helper for rthal_uldivrem, so that the compiler will eliminate
00063    multiple calls with same arguments, at no additionnal cost. */
00064 static inline __attribute_const__ unsigned long long
00065 __rthal_uldivrem(const unsigned long long ull, const unsigned long d) {
00066 
00067     unsigned long long ret;
00068     __asm__ ("divl %1" : "=A,A"(ret) : "r,?m"(d), "A,A"(ull));
00069     /* Exception if quotient does not fit on unsigned long. */
00070     return ret;
00071 }
00072 
00073 static inline __attribute_const__ int rthal_imuldiv (const int i,
00074                                                      const int mult,
00075                                                      const int div) {
00076 
00077     /* Returns (unsigned)i =
00078                (unsigned long long)i*(unsigned)(mult)/(unsigned)div. */
00079     const unsigned long ui = (const unsigned long) i;
00080     const unsigned long um = (const unsigned long) mult;
00081     return __rthal_uldivrem((const unsigned long long) ui * um, div);
00082 }
00083 
00084 /* Fast long long division: when the quotient and remainder fit on 32 bits.
00085    Recent compilers remove redundant calls to this function. */
00086 static inline unsigned long rthal_uldivrem(unsigned long long ull,
00087                                            const unsigned long d,
00088                                            unsigned long *const rp) {
00089 
00090     unsigned long q, r;
00091     ull = __rthal_uldivrem(ull, d);
00092     __asm__ ( "": "=d"(r), "=a"(q) : "A"(ull));
00093     if(rp)
00094         *rp = r;
00095     return q;
00096 }
00097 
00098 
00099 /* Division of an unsigned 96 bits ((h << 32) + l) by an unsigned 32 bits.
00100    Common building block for ulldiv and llimd. */
00101 static inline unsigned long long __rthal_div96by32 (const unsigned long long h,
00102                                                     const unsigned long l,
00103                                                     const unsigned long d,
00104                                                     unsigned long *const rp) {
00105 
00106     u_long rh;
00107     const u_long qh = rthal_uldivrem(h, d, &rh);
00108     const unsigned long long t = __rthal_u64fromu32(rh, l);
00109     const u_long ql = rthal_uldivrem(t, d, rp);
00110 
00111     return __rthal_u64fromu32(qh, ql);
00112 }
00113 
00114 
00115 /* Slow long long division. Uses rthal_uldivrem, hence has the same property:
00116    the compiler removes redundant calls. */
00117 static inline unsigned long long rthal_ulldiv (const unsigned long long ull,
00118                                                const unsigned long d,
00119                                                unsigned long *const rp) {
00120 
00121     unsigned long h, l;
00122     __rthal_u64tou32(ull, h, l);
00123     return __rthal_div96by32(h, l, d, rp);
00124 }
00125 
00126 /* Replaced the helper with rthal_ulldiv. */
00127 #define rthal_u64div32c rthal_ulldiv
00128 
00129 static inline __attribute_const__
00130 unsigned long long __rthal_ullimd (const unsigned long long op,
00131                                    const unsigned long m,
00132                                    const unsigned long d) {
00133 
00134     unsigned long long th, tl;
00135     u_long oph, opl, tlh, tll;
00136 
00137     __rthal_u64tou32(op, oph, opl);
00138     tl = (unsigned long long) opl * m;
00139     __rthal_u64tou32(tl, tlh, tll);
00140     th = (unsigned long long) oph * m;
00141     /* op * m == ((th + tlh) << 32) + tll */
00142 
00143     __asm__ (  "addl %1, %%eax\n\t"
00144                "adcl $0, %%edx"
00145                : "=A,A"(th)
00146                : "r,?m"(tlh), "A,A"(th) );
00147     /* op * m == (th << 32) + tll */
00148 
00149     return __rthal_div96by32(th, tll, d, NULL);
00150 }
00151 
00152 static inline __attribute_const__ long long rthal_llimd (const long long op,
00153                                                          const unsigned long m,
00154                                                          const unsigned long d) {
00155 
00156     if(op < 0LL)
00157         return -__rthal_ullimd(-op, m, d);
00158     return __rthal_ullimd(op, m, d);
00159 }
00160 
00161 static inline __attribute_const__ unsigned long ffnz (unsigned long ul) {
00162     /* Derived from bitops.h's ffs() */
00163     __asm__("bsfl %1, %0"
00164             : "=r,r" (ul)
00165             : "r,?m"  (ul));
00166     return ul;
00167 }

00207 
00208 /* Since real-time interrupt handlers are called on behalf of the
00209    Xenomai domain stack, we cannot infere the "current" Linux task
00210    address using %esp. We must use the suspended Linux domain's stack
00211    pointer instead. */
00212 
00213 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_root_host_task (int cpuid) {
00214     u_long stack = (u_long)rthal_root_domain->esp[cpuid] & ~(THREAD_SIZE - 1);
00215     return ((struct thread_info *)(stack))->task;
00216 }
00217 
00218 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_current_host_task (int cpuid)
00219 {
00220     int *esp;
00221 
00222     __asm__ ("movl %%esp, %0" : "=r,?m" (esp));
00223 
00224     if (esp >= rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] && esp < rthal_domain.estackbase[cpuid] + 2048)
00225         return rthal_root_host_task(cpuid);
00226 
00227     return get_current();
00228 }
00229 
00230 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_CORE || CONFIG_ADEOS_NOTHREADS */
00231 
00232 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_root_host_task (int cpuid)
00233 {
00234     return current;
00235 }
00236 
00237 static inline struct task_struct *rthal_current_host_task (int cpuid)
00238 {
00239     return current;
00240 }

00254 static inline void rthal_timer_program_shot (unsigned long delay)
00255 {
00256     unsigned long flags;
00257 
00258     rthal_local_irq_save_hw(flags);
00259 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00260     if (!delay) {
00261         /* Kick the timer interrupt immediately. */
00262         rthal_trigger_irq(RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI);
00263     } else {
00264     /* Note: reading before writing just to work around the Pentium
00265        APIC double write bug. apic_read_around() expands to nil
00266        whenever CONFIG_X86_GOOD_APIC is set. --rpm */
00267     apic_read_around(APIC_LVTT);
00268     apic_write_around(APIC_LVTT,RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_VECTOR);
00269     apic_read_around(APIC_TMICT);
00270     apic_write_around(APIC_TMICT,delay);
00271     }
00272 #else /* !CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00273     if (!delay)
00274         rthal_trigger_irq(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);
00275     else {
00276         outb(delay & 0xff,0x40);
00277         outb(delay >> 8,0x40);
00278     }
00279 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00280     rthal_local_irq_restore_hw(flags);
00281 }
